com.mokiat.data.front.scanner

Interface IOBJScanner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OBJScanner

    public interface IOBJScanner
    The IOBJScanner interface provides methods through which an OBJ file can be parsed.

    Loading of the file is performed through the usage of parsing events that are raised for each interesting section (e.g. vertex declaration, normal declaration, etc.) of the file.

    Though it does not provide any OBJ representation on completion, this interface provides a mechanism to process the file with a very small memory footprint.

    Author:
    Momchil Atanasov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void scan(BufferedReader reader, IOBJScannerHandler handler)
      Scans the file specified through the BufferedReader and passes any events to the IOBJScannerHandler instance.
      void scan(InputStream in, IOBJScannerHandler handler)
      Scans the file specified through the InputStream and passes any events to the IOBJScannerHandler instance.

    • Method Detail

      • scan

        void scan(InputStream in,
          IOBJScannerHandler handler)
   throws WFException,
          IOException
        Scans the file specified through the InputStream and passes any events to the IOBJScannerHandler instance.
        Parameters:
        in - stream from which to read the file
        handler - handler to be notified of events
        Throws:
        WFException - if the OBJ file is corrupt.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

          IOException

        Parameters:
        reader - reader from which the file will be read
        handler - handler to be notified of events
        Throws:
        WFException - if the OBJ file is corrupt
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
